TITLE: IRS' free tax filing program is at risk amid Trump scrutiny
SUMMARY: The IRS free tax filing program is at risk amid scrutiny from the Trump administration. Here's what taxpayers need to know.

TITLE: Should investors dump U.S. stocks for international equities? Here's what experts are saying
SUMMARY: Global diversification may be a good strategy as U.S. markets come under pressure, some experts say.

SUMMARY: Retirees need at least some stocks in their portfolios to ensure they don't run out of money later, experts said.

TITLE: Is college still worth it? It is for most, but not all, Federal Reserve finds
SUMMARY: Earning a four-year degree is almost always worthwhile, but the return on your investment depends on several key factors.

TITLE: As national average credit score falls, student loan delinquencies are key factor
SUMMARY: The national average credit score fell, driven by missed student loan payments, according to FICO.

TITLE: This homeowner cut her heating bill in half — and got a $1,200 tax credit
SUMMARY: The energy efficient home improvement credit offers up to $3,200 a year to taxpayers. Republicans may scrap the tax break as part of their legislative agenda.

TITLE: Cash may feel safe when stocks slide, but it has risks
SUMMARY: Investors who shift away from stocks for perceived safe havens like cash are likely sacrificing their well-being decades from now.

TITLE: There's another surprise tax deadline on April 15. Here's how to avoid penalties, experts say
SUMMARY: The first-quarter estimated tax deadline for 2025 is April 15, which is also the federal tax due date for most filers. Here's how to avoid penalties.

TITLE: How a trade war could impact the price of clothing: 'Ultimately no one wins,' expert says
SUMMARY: Few consumer goods are immune from the effects of new tariffs on imported goods, but apparel may be among the hardest hit.

TITLE: Democratic senators press Social Security Administration on reports of 'dangerous' employee cuts
SUMMARY: Reported plans to cut staff at an important Social Security Administration department would be "dangerous," Democratic senators wrote in a letter to the agency.

TITLE: With time running out, here are some tax tips for last-minute filers
SUMMARY: The deadline to file a 2024 federal tax return in the U.S. is April 15. Here's what you need to know now about dates, documents and extensions.

TITLE: How tuition-free college programs can backfire: More generous aid 'can actually increase inequity,' expert says
SUMMARY: More generous financial aid packages also attract more students, which can make it harder for lower-income students to benefit.

TITLE: Can't pay your taxes by April 15? You have options, IRS says
SUMMARY: You have options if you can't pay your taxes by April 15, according to the IRS. Here's what taxpayers need to know.

TITLE: Is now a good time to buy gold? Here’s what you need to know
SUMMARY: Experts recommend getting investment exposure to gold through an exchange-traded fund. However, demand for gold bars, coins and even gold jewelry, is also up.

TITLE: Op-ed: Regulated finance needs to build trust with Gen Z
SUMMARY: They may be boring, but regulated institutions are the best resource for young people to get basic, free money information, writes former FDIC Chair Sheila Bair.

TITLE: What advisors are telling their clients after the latest bond market sell-off
SUMMARY: As investors digest the latest bond market sell-off, advisors have tips about portfolio allocation amid continued market volatility.

TITLE: Social Security cost-of-living adjustment projected to be lower in 2026, estimates find. But tariffs may change that
SUMMARY: New government inflation data points to a lower Social Security cost-of-living adjustment for 2026 compared to the 2.5% increase beneficiaries saw in 2025.

TITLE: 73% of Americans are financially stressed. Two-thirds say tariff concerns are the source: CNBC survey
SUMMARY: A new CNBC survey finds Americans are financially stressed, with a majority concerned tariffs will hurt their finances, and 34% have made investment changes.

TITLE: Tariffs, trade war inflation impact to be 'pretty ugly' by summer, economists say
SUMMARY: Tariffs will take a few months to filter through to consumer prices, economists said.

SUMMARY: The Trump administration recently announced that it would begin a process to overhaul the country's $1.6 trillion student loan system. Here's what to know.

SUMMARY: The consumer price index fell in March, but President Donald Trump's tariff agenda and the specter of a global trade war threaten to reverse progress.

SUMMARY: The Social Security Administration on Monday will put new policies into effect aimed at preventing fraud for benefit claims. Here's what applicants can expect.

SUMMARY: There's still time to claim the $1,400 IRS stimulus check by April 15. Here's how to check on the status of your payment.

SUMMARY: Families saving for their children's education in a 529 plan may be on edge amid recent market volatility. Financial experts share their tips.

SUMMARY: Amid tariff volatility, investors could leverage tax-loss harvesting, which uses losses to offset other portfolio gains. Here's what to know about the strategy.

SUMMARY: The recent S&P 500 selloff, fueled by fear of the impact of President Donald Trump's tariff policy, was the worst since the early days of the Covid-19 pandemic.

TITLE: Taking one personal finance class in high school has a lifetime benefit of roughly $100,000
SUMMARY: Taking a financial education class in high school pays off, many studies show.

SUMMARY: Amid an ongoing market selloff, some investors may be tempted to cash out in a flight to safety. Yet research shows they'll likely regret it.
